document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Argyresthia Hübner, [1825] (Lepidoptera: Yponomeutoidea: Argyresthiidae) from China, with descriptions of forty-three new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the genus Argyresthia Hübner, [1825] (Lepidoptera: Yponomeutoidea: Argyresthiidae) from China, with descriptions of forty-three new species

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Argyresthia beta
Friese & Moriuti, 1968 : 15
. TL: Japan (Mt. Makinosan, Izumi, Honsyû). TD: UOPJ.

subSubSection.paragraph: Male genitalia : As in Figs. 134 , 190 and 246 .

Host plant :
Rhododendron macrosepalum Maximowicz
( Ericaceae ) (Moriuti 1968).
Distribution. China ( Guizhou , Hubei , Zhejiang ), Japan .

Diagnosis. This species is similar to
A. ( A. ) alpha
and
A. ( A. ) taiwanensis
in having a short broad white dorsal band on the forewing, a white dorsal spot beyond the middle of the wing, and a dark dorsal spot before the middle of the wing (between the preceeding white band and spot).
Argyresthia ( A. ) beta
can be separated from the latter two species by the forewing having a triangular white dorsal spot beyond the middle of the wing, which is subtrapezoidal in the latter two species. In the male genitalia of
A. ( A. ) beta
the phallus is 3.8 times as long as the width of the valva ( Figs. 134 , 190 ), whereas it is 7.0 times as long as the width of the valva in
A. ( A. ) alpha
( Figs. 133 , 189 ) and 2.8 in
A. ( A. ) taiwanensis
.
Argyresthia ( A. ) alpha
can be further separated from
A. ( A. ) taiwanensis
by the forewing having a quadrate golden-brown dorsal spot before the middle of the wing, which extends obliquely outward in the latter species.
